### gatherResourceInfo() {#a3681fb2c471c1278bfd939456c752f22}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCResourceInfo::gatherResourceInfo (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/amdgpuresourceusageanalysis/sifunctionresourceinfo">AMDGPUResourceUsageAnalysis::SIFunctionResourceInfo</a> &amp; FRI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mccontext">MCContext</a> &amp; OutContext)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/amdgpuresourceusageanalysis">AMDGPUResourceUsageAnalysis</a> gathers resource usage on a per-function granularity.

However, some resource info has to be assigned the call transitive maximum or accumulative. For example, if A calls B and B&#39;s VGPR usage exceeds A&#39;s, A should be assigned B&#39;s VGPR usage. Furthermore, functions with indirect calls should be assigned the module level maximum.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumcresourceinfo-h/#l00093">93</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumcresourceinfo-h">AMDGPUMCResourceInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumcresourceinfo-cpp/#l00156">156</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumcresourceinfo-cpp">AMDGPUMCResourceInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
